get.summary: Returns all invoices
get.description:
Returns a list of all invoices. Invoices represent valid legal documents consisting of one or multiple positions and a total sum.
Invoices come in several types:
  • Invoice: an invoice you sent to a customer.
  • Advance Invoice: an advance payment invoice that you sent to a customer.
  • Final Invoice: the final invoice of one or several advance invoices.
  • Cancellation: a cancellation of an invoice or advance invoice.

post.description:
When creating a final invoice manually (not by the action 'CreateFinalInvoice' on a quotation), this action gives you the possibility to attach created advance invoices to the invoice.

Creates the final invoice for the given quotation. The final invoice automatically includes all advance invoices which have been created for this quotation.
            This action is only required when advance invoices have been created for the quotation.

post.summary: Creates an advance invoice for a quotation
post.description:
Creates an advance invoice for the given quotation. An advance invoice represents an invoice which only includes a part of the whole quotation sum. This fraction can either be a percentage of the quotation sum or a defined fixed sum.
            Remember when creating advance invoices, a final invoice has to be created at the end of the billing process which then automatically includes the complete total sum and summarizes the send advance invoices.

parameters.name: QuotationsV1CreateAdvanceInvoiceParameters
parameters.description: The parameter object, where 'invoiceType' and 'advanceInvoiceValue' are required. 'invoiceType' can either be '1' (take a certain percentage of the whole invoice for the advance invoice) or '2' (make an advance invoice with a fixed sum in the invoice currency). In case of a percentage, 'advanceInvoiceValue' represents the percentage value 0-100. In case of a fixed sum, it represents the net sum of the advance invoice, which must be less or equal to the quotation total.

post.summary: Creates an invoice for a quotation

Returns all projects
get.description: A project represents a service you are performing for a customer, like a job or any other project-based service.

get.summary: Returns the project with the specified id

post.summary: Creates a new project
post.description:
Creates a new project.
            The parameter requirements are depending on the template.
            
            External Projects require:
            - CompanyId
            
            Internal Projects Require:
            - ResponsibleUserId
            
            External Projects also allow a contactPerson to be set.
            
            If the template has a number schema, any number parameter will be ignored. If there is no 
            number schema, the number parameter is optional as the next valid project number will be 
            generated and used.
            
            The ProjectStatusId is optional. If none is provided, the first valid ProjectStatus for 
            the given template will be used.
            
            The StartDate will be used as the PlannendStartDate and for the start date of the first project
            plan task.

items.description: An invoice represents an outgoing invoice, cancellation or advance payment invoice you send to your customers.

BookingDate.description: The date this invoice was booked

Status.description: The status of this credit note

Currency.description: The ISO 4217 code of the currency of this document.

ExchangeRate.description:
The exchange rate to Euro.
            While the document is in a draft state, the exchange rate reflects the current exchange rate of ECB.
            After the document has been sent, the exchange rate at that date will be returned.

DeliveryDate.description: The date of the delivery of the products or services.

PaymentConditionId.description: The Id of the payment condition.

DeliveryConditionId.description: The Id of the delivery condition.

PaymentCondition.description: The payment condition that applies to this document

DeliveryCondition.description: The delivery condition that applies to this document

DiscountType.description: Whether the document discount is specified as a total or a percentage.

Discount.description:
A discount that should be applied to the total sum.
            This is either a total or a percantage value, depending on the DiscountType.

Margin.description:
A margin (as a percentage) that should be applied to the total sum.
            This margin will be equally distributed over all positions.

TaxOption.description:
The tax rule that should apply to this document.
            VAT is most commonly used for documents within the same country.

ServiceOption.description: Whether the positions in this document are a delivery or any other kind of service.

NetTotal.description:
The net sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

GrossTotal.description:
The gross sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position taxes, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

VatTotal.description:
The sum of the position VAT.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

PaidTotal.description:
The sum of received payments for this document.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

DiscountType.description: Whether the document discount is specified as a total or a percentage.

Discount.description:
A discount that should be applied to the total sum.
            This is either a total or a percantage value, depending on the DiscountType.

Margin.description:
A margin (as a percentage) that should be applied to the total sum.
            This margin will be equally distributed over all positions.

TaxOption.description:
The tax rule that should apply to this document.
            VAT is most commonly used for documents within the same country.

ServiceOption.description: Whether the positions in this document are a delivery or any other kind of service.

NetTotal.description:
The net sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

GrossTotal.description:
The gross sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position taxes, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

VatTotal.description:
The sum of the position VAT.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

PaidTotal.description:
The sum of received payments for this document.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

items.description: A quotation represents an outgoing quotation you send to your customers.

ValidUntilDate.description: The date this quotation is valid to

Status.description: The status of this quotation

Currency.description: The ISO 4217 code of the currency of this document.

ExchangeRate.description:
The exchange rate to Euro.
            While the document is in a draft state, the exchange rate reflects the current exchange rate of ECB.
            After the document has been sent, the exchange rate at that date will be returned.

DeliveryDate.description: The date of the delivery of the products or services.

PaymentConditionId.description: The Id of the payment condition.

DeliveryConditionId.description: The Id of the delivery condition.

PaymentCondition.description: The payment condition that applies to this document

DeliveryCondition.description: The delivery condition that applies to this document

DiscountType.description: Whether the document discount is specified as a total or a percentage.

Discount.description:
A discount that should be applied to the total sum.
            This is either a total or a percantage value, depending on the DiscountType.

Margin.description:
A margin (as a percentage) that should be applied to the total sum.
            This margin will be equally distributed over all positions.

TaxOption.description:
The tax rule that should apply to this document.
            VAT is most commonly used for documents within the same country.

ServiceOption.description: Whether the positions in this document are a delivery or any other kind of service.

NetTotal.description:
The net sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

GrossTotal.description:
The gross sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position taxes, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

VatTotal.description:
The sum of the position VAT.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

PaidTotal.description:
The sum of received payments for this document.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

DiscountType.description: Whether the document discount is specified as a total or a percentage.

Discount.description:
A discount that should be applied to the total sum.
            This is either a total or a percantage value, depending on the DiscountType.

Margin.description:
A margin (as a percentage) that should be applied to the total sum.
            This margin will be equally distributed over all positions.

TaxOption.description:
The tax rule that should apply to this document.
            VAT is most commonly used for documents within the same country.

ServiceOption.description: Whether the positions in this document are a delivery or any other kind of service.

NetTotal.description:
The net sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

GrossTotal.description:
The gross sum of the document. This is calculated considering all positions, position taxes, position and document margin as well as position and document discount.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

VatTotal.description:
The sum of the position VAT.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

PaidTotal.description:
The sum of received payments for this document.
            The sum is to be interpreted in the document currency.
            Read-only.

items.description:
An absence represents a time of absence from work, for example holidays or sickness. 
            Absences can be either paid or unpaid.

Start.description: The start date or date time of this absence, depending on the type. In ISO 8601 format.

End.description: The end date or date time of this absence, depending on the type. In ISO 8601 format.

Note.description: The user-provided note for this absence

UserId.description: The id of the user this absence is for

User.description: The user this absence is for

MissedDays.description:
The number of working days missed by this absence. Takes overlapping other absences into account.
            Read-only!
            This value is only applicable for full- and half-day absences (sick leave and vacation)
